description.narrative: A stop on the legendary Silk Road, the Dayahatyn caravanserai is among the best preserved caravanserais dating from a period of intensive trade between East and West. title.narrative: Strengthening the National Action Plan on TIP in Turkmenistan to Ensure Coordinated Assistance and a Victim-centered Approach

description.narrative: IOM will strengthen the National Action Plan on human trafficking in Turkmenistan to ensure coordinated assistance and a victim-centered approach. Activities will include strengthening the national human trafficking legislation; training law enforcement, judicial officials, and prosecutors on trafficking; supporting the government to develop a National Referral Mechanism (NRM); and forming Memoranda of Understanding (MOUs) between government and civil society for the effective implementation of the NRM.

title.narrative: Preservation of the Literary Legacy of the 18th-Century Turkmen Philsophical Poet Magtymguly Pyragy

description.narrative: The year 2024 marks the 300th anniversary of the birth of Turkmen poet and philosopher Magtymguly Pyragy, whose writings called for unity at a time of heightened tribal division. This project includes the conservation of ten hand-copied manuscripts of Magtymguly's poetry, a conservation workshop, educational programs for students, speaker series at American Corners in Turkmenistan, and a print publication.

title.narrative: Preservation of the 6th-Century Greater and Lesser Kyz Kalas at Ancient Merv

description.narrative: To support the continuation of work begun under a previous Ambassadors Fund grant to preserve the Greater and Lesser Kyz Kalas, two monumental mud brick fortresses from the late Sassanid and early Islamic periods (6th -8th centuries). Renowned for their tapering corrugated columnar walls, the two fortresses are highly susceptible to erosion from wind, rainwater runoff, and other factors. This project involves remedial and preventive conservation activities and the implementation of a long-term monitoring and maintenance program.

title.narrative: Preservation of Unique Recordings of Early Folk Music at the National Conservatory of Turkmenistan

description.narrative: To support the preservation of early folk music recordings at the National Conservatory of Turkmenistan. From 1974 until 1999, ethnographic expeditions to Turkmen tribes throughout Turkmenistan and parts of Russia and Uzbekistan recorded styles, genres, and local variations of traditional music, resulting in a collection which now is endangered as its tape and vinyl recordings decay. The project involves the stabilization and preservation of these original formats and the digitization of the recordings for dissemination and use.

title.narrative: Preservation of the Ismamyt-Ata Monument, Phase 3

description.narrative: A few brick and plaster structures at Ismamyt-Ata are all that remain of a once-thriving medieval town, now an important sacred site for Turkmen, Uzbeks, and Kazakhs. This third and final project completes work begun under previous Ambassadors Fund grants to conserve all the structures within the monument.

title.narrative: Preservation of the 12th-Century Silk Road Caravanserai at Dayahatyn

description.narrative: To support the preservation of the Dayahatyn caravanserai of the Silk Road, the last remaining structure of its kind in Central Asia. The 12th-century baked brick structure has deteriorated to the point of near-collapse at the same time that pressures from international tourism have increased. The project involves the comprehensive documentation and stabilization of the site and the restoration of walls and other damaged portions of the structure.

title.narrative: Global Rapid Response Project

description.narrative: Focused on the development of a National Action Plan on Combatting Trafficking in Persons, IOM will host a workshop in Turkmenistan, aiming to familiarize participants with national action plans in Central Asia and neighboring nations, and to facilitate their cooperation in the development of a plan for Turkmenistan. The workshop, scheduled for April 29-30, 2013, will include approximately 30 prosecutors, law enforcement officers and other government officials, as well as five NGO representatives.
